data.title: Jim: The James Foley Story
data.meta_description: ★★★☆☆A deeply personal film that’s often moving, Jim: The James Foley Story is a documentary that nonetheless falls short of greatness by virtue of the blind loyalty it demonstrates towards its
data.text:
★★★☆☆

A deeply personal film that’s often moving, Jim: The James Foley Story is a documentary that nonetheless falls short of greatness by virtue of the blind loyalty it demonstrates towards its subject. The movie tells the story of Foley, the 40-year-old journalist video-reporter who was kidnapped in Syria in 2012 and who, in 2014, became the first American citizen to be executed by what was then the newly emergent Islamic State.

Foley was beheaded on camera (footage that, thankfully, is not shown here) in an IS propaganda video. Images from that video, of Foley staring blank-eyed in an orange jumpsuit next to his killer, Mohammed Emwazi (aka Jihadi John), spread around the globe, quickly becoming visual shorthand for a new kind of terror.

This
